description: The Pelican Flower (Aristolochia gigantea) is truly an amazing species. It bears unique and eye-catching flower tubes, reaching up to 4-8 inches in length, which are red-brown speckled with yellow or white spots. It has dissected leaves that look like a pelican's wing and an intriguing dizzying array of flowers that include specimens shaped like logs or curds that dangle down from the plant via strings. Its fragrance is described as bee-fascinating and it's a magnet for resources that will help to pollinate the species. Finally, the Pelican Flower has the ability to self-pollinate. This makes it a fascinating and valuable species in the flower garden.
